q: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
h:
“Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Trust is the foundation of great leadership.
h:
“Trust is the foundation of great leadership.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.
h:
“Adventure is not outside man; it is within.” —
George Eliot

q: A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all.
h:
“A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
h:
“Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Be as fluid as water, do not give your enemies anything solid to attack.
h:
“Be as fluid as water, do not give your enemies anything solid to attack.” —
Robert Greene

q: Simple words, repeated daily, can change your life.
h:
“Simple words, repeated daily, can change your life.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Not all those who wander are lost.
h:
“Not all those who wander are lost.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: To lead the people, walk behind them.
h:
“To lead the people, walk behind them.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
h:
“Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
h:
“It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.
h:
“Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.” —
Robert Greene

q: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
h:
“Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.” —
Bob Marley

q: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
h:
“Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Don't give up the fight, Stand up for your rights.
h:
“Don't give up the fight, Stand up for your rights.” —
Bob Marley

q: Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.
h:
“Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.” —
Dogen

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
h:
“Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?” —
Rumi

q: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
h:
“We suffer more often in imagination than in reality. ” —
Seneca

q: Productize your perspective.
h:
“Productize your perspective.” —
Jack Butcher

q: The person who is his own master cannot tolerate another boss.
h:
“The person who is his own master cannot tolerate another boss. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
h:
“What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.
h:
“What kills the creative force is not age or lack of talent, but our own spirit, our own attitude.” —
Robert Greene

q: If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.
h:
“If you focus on results and finding shortcuts, you'll get impatient. If you focus on the process and doing the right thing, you'll be unstoppable.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Little by little, one travels far.
h:
“Little by little, one travels far.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.
h:
“Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
h:
“Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.” —
Robert Collier

q: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
h:
“Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: It's wise to tell the truth. It's even wiser to tell it kindly.
h:
“It's wise to tell the truth. It's even wiser to tell it kindly.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.
h:
“Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.” —
Peter Drucker

q: The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said.
h:
“The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't being said.” —
Peter Drucker

q: We must have strong minds, ready to accept facts as they are.
h:
“We must have strong minds, ready to accept facts as they are.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.
h:
“The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.” —
Socrates

q: Courage is found in unlikely places.
h:
“Courage is found in unlikely places.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
h:
“Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
h:
“Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: What are we doing here, that is the question.
h:
“What are we doing here, that is the question.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Instead of thinking about what you are going to do when you retire, think about how you can do that now and make a living from it.
h:
“Instead of thinking about what you are going to do when you retire, think about how you can do that now and make a living from it.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Winning isn't always championships.
h:
“Winning isn't always championships.” —
Michael Jordan

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them.
h:
“We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them. ” —
Seneca

q: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.
h:
“No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.” —
Albert Einstein

q: What have you done today to make someone else happy?
h:
“What have you done today to make someone else happy?” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
h:
“When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.” —
Walt Disney

q: Character is doing what you don't want to do but know you should do.
h:
“Character is doing what you don't want to do but know you should do.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.
h:
“Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.” —
John Wooden

q: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
h:
“You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.
h:
“Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.” —
Og Mandino

q: Success is a poor teacher.
h:
“Success is a poor teacher.” —
Robert Kiyosaki
